events.name: Quantum Shorts
events.description:
Quantum Shorts 
Saturday - Tuesday - 25 - 28 Feb
10am-7pm
Level 4, Expression Gallery 
Free. Register in the Lobby.

Take a mind trip in quantumland with ten short films from the shortlist of the Quantum Shorts Film Festival this weekend. Laugh, wonder and contemplate about physics over popcorn, compliments of the house from 1-5pm daily. If the big questions are keeping you up at night, it’s probably time to come down and have a chat with our resident physicist from 1- 4pm. 

Run by the Centre for Quantum Technologies at the National University of Singapore with a constellation of prestigious partners including Scientific American and Nature, the Quantum Shorts contest series is now in its fifth year. Films from the festival draw inspiration from or are related to themes and ideas of quantum physics.

Special Event: Panel Discussion with Dagomir Kaszlikowski
Saturday, 25 February | 2 – 3pm

Experience the ideas of quantum physics with a lively talk by Dagomir Kaszlikowski (Quantum Shorts Film Festival Panellist and Principal Investigator at Centre of Quantum Technologies), who will also share more about the Quantum Shorts Film Festival. The session is moderated by Jenny Hogan (Manager of Outreach and Media Relations at the Centre for Quantum Technologies).

FILMS

Bolero, by Ivan D’Antonio 
Ampersand, by Erin Shea and Simón Wilches Castro
Approaching Reality. by Simone De Liberato 
Novae, by Thomas Vanz
The Guardian, by Dr Chetan Kotabage 
Tom’s Breakfast, by Ben Garfield
Triangulation, by Vladimir Vlasenko 
Whitecap, by Bernard Ong 
Together- Parallel Universe, by Michael Robertson

Films will be shown on a loop.
